job.title: System Administrator - Windows / Citrix Engineer
job.industry: Information Technology and Services,Defense & Space,Computer Software
job.description:
The primary duty of this role will be working to integrate Windows desktops within a Citrix environment.
Primary Duties & Responsibilities
Managing system uptime and availability for Windows/Citrix servers in a VMware virtualized architecture
Configuring, managing, and troubleshooting issues with Windows and Citrix servers
Applying operating system and software patches and upgrades for Windows/Citrix servers and workstations
Working with team members to manage port, protocol, and network configuration information for Windows/Citrix servers and hosted applications
Working with team members to implement IAVs and STIG mitigations to satisfy cybersecurity requirements
Collaborating with other team members to develop, implement, and revise processes to meet technical and security-related requirements for administration of Windows/Citrix servers and workstations
Documenting, communicating and implementing standardized processes and procedures for effective administration of servers and workstations
Maintaining all DoDD 8140.01 Cyberspace Workforce Management qualifying criteria certifications, an active clearance and all annual required training
Minimum Skills & Requirements
Five plus (5+) years of prior relevant experience
Comprehensive knowledge of the following:
ESXi 6.0 and 6.7
Windows 2008 and above
Windows Core 2016
RHEL 6 and above
AD Domain components (DNS, Sites and Service, Group policy, DHCP)
Possess strong troubleshooting skills.
CompTIA Security + (or higher) certification
Desired Skills & Requirements
Experience with any of the following is a plus:
Citrix 7.15 on Nutanix
ForcePoint TTC
Veeam
Exchange
PowerShell
General networking
vSAN
Rubrik
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent education or work experience
Advanced certifications, such as Red Hat Certified Engineer (RHCE) or Red Hat Certified System Administrator (RHCSA), Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) Or Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP), or similar
Experience with CI/CD processes
